frame.name: Accompaniment
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Co_participant</fen> fills the same role as the <fen>Participant</fen> in an event or relation. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Partic">The mayor</fex> was killed <t>along</t> <t>with</t> <fex name="Co-Th">three bodyguards and his driver</fex>.</ex>
<ex>The doctor told me to take <fex name="Partic">my regular pill</fex> <t>in</t> <t>combination</t> <fex name="Co-Th">with the new drug</fex> and I will be cured of my symptoms.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participant
FE.definition: <def-root>In this frame, <fen>Participant</fen> is the accompanied entity (person or object).<ex><fex name="Participant">Charlie</fex> played the piano <t>with</t> Lily.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition: <def-root>In this frame, <fen>Co-participant</fen> is the accompanying entity (person or object).<ex>Charlie played the piano <t>with</t> <fex name="Co-participant">Lily</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participants
FE.definition:
<def-root>Two or more entities construed as symmetrically and usually equally participating in an event or relation.
<ex><fex name="Participants">Lao Tzu and Confucious</fex> built the house <t>together</t>.</ex></def-root>
